name: Ballyrobin Country Lodge

reviews.text: Lovely dining room nice menu but main course a serious letdown. My friend had a teeny portion of very fatty duck with a huge helping of mash. I had very strange combination of soggy deepfried monk fish swimming on a sea of drowned noodles with only big chunks of rawish peppers for company. My desert of shortbread, peaches, cream and fruit sauce was beautiful. Friend stuck to the cheeseboard and did complain about the quality of the duck. This was well handled with her cheeseboard being removed from the bill. Just go for the pudding and have some excellent coffee with it!
reviews.title: this is a review of the restaurant only

reviews.text: As a NI expat living in Scotland, I had risen at 0430am (too early for breakfast) before driving down the A9 to get to Edinburgh Airport for a 0815 flight to Belfast Internationial. As fate would have it, the usual fast food outlets on the way were shut and despite the fact that I could have eaten a "donkey buttered" I am too miserable to buy airport meals. It was therefore a ratty traveller who arrived at the car hire desk where a pleasant young lady recommended the Ballyrobin.
reviews.title: SERVICE WITH A SMILE STILL VERY MUCH IN EXISTENCE

reviews.text: Called in just after 0900 where a really pleasant girl called Helen sorted me out with a "full Ulster" and what a full Ulster it was!My request to replace the soda with extra taty bread was no problem and the whole place was just great service and good food. This was the best full Ulster I have ever had. The only feedback I would offer was that the inclusive fruit juice was the cheap concentrate rather than the real thing which is a shame when everything else was just right. As a middle aged cynic I really thought friendly service, happy staff and good food at a fair price was a thing of the past but this place has got it.
reviews.title: lovely breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My sons and I always have breakfast here if we arrive in to Aldergrove early. They always ask if we are going to have a Ballyrobin breakfast and really look forward to it - beats anything the airport can offer. I love the decor - there is so much to look at and it's so well put together.
reviews.title: great for a romantic meal

reviews.text: just thought id put a few words up about the fantastic ballyrobin. we found this place while looking for somewhere different for a meal, if your looking for a romantic restaurant outside the city you wont go wrong, the steak and peppered sauce is amoung the best i've had around belfast and the setting is rustic and charming.
reviews.title: Country hotel

reviews.text: Driving back to Belfast International Airport for a 11.00am flight we decided to call into the Ballyrobin for an Ulster Fry. The place itself is very nice & we were given the menu immediately - £8.95 for an Ulster Fry. The food arrived very quickly but when we asked for some toast & bread we were told the delivery had not arrived. The food was not very tasty & to add insult to injury we were charged an extra £1.50 ?? each for the tea & coffee served. In our view this was not value for money, Northern Ireland is renouned for its Ulster Fry, we will not be going back here again.
reviews.title: Ulster Fry - I don't think so!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on Friday December 28th in Belfast for one week holidays. We asked the Tourism Office at the airport to indicate us a close by hotel for just one night (we had to pick-up the car the next morning at the airport).
reviews.title: Cozy but noisy

likes.liked: — Location close from the aiport and warm atmosphere
likes.disliked: — Our room was just above the kitchen so smells, noise of ventilation and noises of the breakfast's preparation in the morning.

reviews.title: A home away from home.
reviews.text: The hotel, 2 min taxi drive from airport, was nice (cozy), the room was sweet (Cottage Room) but unfortunately that room is above the kitchen so the smell and the noise is quite strong (+ kitchen vent in front of room window). But the service and the food were excellent! If you like seeing the planes take off (+ the noise), it's a great place to spend one night (but maybe not more....)
I've had the pleasure of staying here a few times now. I travel to Belfast quite frequently with work and actually I look forward to my trips when I know that I'll be staying at the Ballyrobin.
reviews.title: Lovely setting & Good Food

description: This centuries old Guest House oozes homely charm inside and out. The brand new bedrooms have added unexpected chic with boutique comfort and style. As for the food? You’ll have to travel a long way to find as good. Whether it’s a hearty breakfast, a quick bite before your flight, a business lunch or a special occasion, Ballyrobin’s mouth watering all day gastro menu is worth checking in for.
